name: FieldPath
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldPath
description:
FieldPath

Represents a field path to the Firestore API. See Client#field_path.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

user_snap = firestore.doc("users/frank").get

nested_field_path = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldPath.new(
  :favorites, :food
)
user_snap.get(nested_field_path) #=> "Pizza"

methods.name: initialize
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldPath#initialize
methods.description: Creates a field path object representing a nested field for document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

user_snap = firestore.doc("users/frank").get

nested_field_path = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldPath.new(
  :favorites, :food
)
user_snap.get(nested_field_path) #=> "Pizza"

params.name: fields
params.description:
One or more
strings representing the path of the data to select. Each field must
be provided separately.

methods.name: document_id
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldPath.document_id
methods.description: Creates a field path object representing the sentinel ID of a document. It can be used in queries to sort or filter by the document ID. See Client#document_id.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a collection reference
cities_col = firestore.col "cities"

# Create a query
query = cities_col.start_at("NYC").order(
  Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldPath.document_id
)

query.get do |city|
  puts "#{city.document_id} has #{city[:population]} residents."
end
